meanings.definition: Valuable or worth keeping as a treasure.
meanings.sent1: The old photo albums are treasurable to me.
meanings.sent2: Family heirlooms are often treasurable possessions.
meanings.sent3: Finding a hidden treasure map would be treasurable!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a treasurable gem in a sea of frowns.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted a treasurable scene in the sky.

meanings.definition: Capable of being treasured or cherished.
meanings.sent1: The handmade gift was treasurable to the recipient.
meanings.sent2: A loyal friend is truly treasurable in life.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy made a treasurable mess in the living room.
meanings.sent4: His words of wisdom were a treasurable gift to the students.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower was a treasurable find in the forest.
